column7: This is a continuation in the study of advanced statistical modeling techniques with a focus on categorical data. The course explores logistic regression, generalized linear models, goodness-of-fit, link functions, count regression, log-linear models, probability models for contingency tables, and ordinal response models. Statistical computing is an integral part of the course. 3 undergraduate hours. 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: STAT 410; STAT 425.
column9: 3 undergraduate hours. 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: STAT 410; STAT 425.
